N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 16 ยง 502.1 - Standards

State Regulations

Every water-works corporation shall on or before November
15, 1935, submit for the approval of this commission proposed amendments to its
tariff schedules setting forth rules and regulations covering the construction
and maintenance of service pipes, such rules and regulations, among other
things, to provide: (a) The minimum
depth at which all service pipes shall be laid. The depth so fixed to be
sufficient to prevent freezing. (b) The size and kind of pipe and apparatus to be installed, service pipes to be at
least three- quarters inch in diameter except under unusual circumstances which
shall be clearly defined. (c) All
connections of service pipes with the transmission mains where the covering
over the main is less than five foot shall be made on the side of the main and
the service pipe shall in no case have less covering than the main. Notes
